alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 8:35AM EST until March 09 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Indiana, including the following counties, Bartholomew, Johnson and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 835 AM EST, River gauge reports indicate rises on area creeks and streams due to heavy rain yesterday. Flooding continues on waterways in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbus, Shelbyville, Franklin, Edinburgh, Flat Rock, Princes Lakes, Morristown, Trafalgar, Fairland, Clifford, Marietta, Boggstown, Taylorsville and Peoga. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
